original_title: Lowering of bank interest rates injects robustness to CSE; turnover hits Rs. 4 billion
original_body_lines: The stock market yesterday kicked off on a positive note and investor participation reached a satisfactory level while turnover touched more than Rs 4 billion due to lowering of bank interest rates. This enabled people to invest in the stock market, market analysts said.
Both indices moved upwards. The All Share Price Index went up by 130.7 points while the S and P SL20 went up by 68.7 points. Turnover stood at Rs 4.7 billion with seven crossings.

Those crossings were reported in Hayleys, where 7.1 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 757 million and its shares traded at Rs 106, Sampath Bank 6.2 million shares crossed for Rs 530 million; its shares sold at Rs 85, JKH 408,000 shares crossed for Rs. 84.2 million; its shares traded at Rs 207, Resus Energy 3 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 84 million; its shares traded at Rs 28, Central Finance 600,000 shares crossed for Rs 73.8 million; its shares traded at Rs 123, CIC Holdings 800,000 shares crossed to the tune of Rs 61.6 million; its share sold at Rs 77 and DFCC 750,000 shares crossed for Rs 60 million; its shares fetched Rs 80.

In the retail market, companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; JKH Rs 538 million (2.5 million shares traded), Sampath Bank Rs 375 million (3.9 million shares traded), HNB Rs 165 million (758,000 shares traded), Hayleys Rs 146 million (1.6 million shares traded), Sunshine Holdings Rs 96 million (1.4 million shares traded), LVL Energy Fund Rs 95.1 million (15.1 million shares traded) and CIC Holdings Rs 74 million (985,000 shares traded). During the day 124 million share volumes changed hands in 19000 transactions.
It is said that the manufacturing sector contributed to the turnover mainly, especially JKH and Hayleys. The banking and finance sector was the second largest contributor to the turnover.
Yesterday, the rupee depreciated slightly to open at Rs 293.60/80 to the US dollar, from Rs 293.45/55 a day earlier, while bond yields were broadly steady, dealers said.

A bond maturing on 15.12.2027 was quoted at 11.40/50 percent, up from 11.35/50 percent. A bond maturing on 15.03.2028 was quoted at 11.75/80 percent, down from 11.70/80 percent. A bond maturing on 15.09.2029 was quoted at 12.00/10 percent, up from 11.95/12.10 percent.
